intro: Hemianthus elatinoides, commonly known as the cotton plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is characterized by its small, white flowers and its ability to produce a fluffy, cotton-like seed covering. The plant belongs to the Malvaceae family and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. It thrives in warm climates and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Hemianthus elatinoides is also known for its rapid growth rate and is sometimes used in ornamental gardening.
